comments.raw_text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.2; rv:9.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/9.0.1
Build ID: 20111220165912

Steps to reproduce:

Visit a silverlight website, e.g: http://demos.telerik.com/silverlight/
Issue 1: While downloading, press Ctrl+F5 "Force Reload", the page will reload, but you will see the download resumes instead of starting from the beginning. (the percent of downloading is visible). Because "Range" http header is sent which shouldn't.
Issue 2: Let the page load completely and the website to work. Press Ctrl+F5 the page will reload but the plugin will not. The cached "xap" file will be used.

Note: this happens for all silverlight websites, flash and other plugins are not tested.
(You will need silverlight in order to test this: http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=229320 )


Actual results:

explained above.


Expected results:

Fresh reload.

comments.text:
Gecko doesn't load the silverlight file.
The silverlight plugin is started with the <object data=..> tag and the plugin gets all <param name=..> parameters.
The plugin itself now requests the file.
comments.raw_text:
Gecko doesn't load the silverlight file.
The silverlight plugin is started with the <object data=..> tag and the plugin gets all <param name=..> parameters.
The plugin itself now requests the file.

comments.author: salar2k@gmail.com

comments.raw_text: Oh, right. So the plugin somehow should be alerted to do a reload! Is it possible?
comments.text: Oh, right. So the plugin somehow should be alerted to do a reload! Is it possible?

comments.raw_text:
I've noticed this works as expected in other browsers i tested: IE8, Opera11 and Chrome 15!
Only in Firefox I see this issue.
